summary: Say hello to Wowbagger. He is on a mission to insult You, the Universe and it's Cat.
descriptionHtml:
[center]

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75498-1-1462737182.gif[/img]
[font=Comic Sans MS][color=#f4f4f4][size=4]Say hello to Wowbagger.
He's on a mission to insult you, the universe... and it's cat!

[youtube]mPxjd8O5lQA[/youtube]

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75498-2-1462661665.gif[/img][/size][/color][/font]
Meet Wowbagger, the one and only mean green, insulting machine... a custom voiced and standalone summon-able companion who is on a mission to insult everyone, especially you!

[color=#00ff00][size=4][b][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75498-3-1462661665.gif[/img][/b][/size][/color]
Summon him when you want  (that way you'll never get bored).
Custom spells
Custom Voice featuring over 350 insults
A couple of small but hopefully entertaining quests

[color=#00ff00][size=4][b][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75498-0-1462662541.gif[/img][/b][/size][/color]

You can meet him at the Riften Bee & Barb, but you'll have to complete a very small mission before you can learn his summon spell.

[color=#00ff00][size=3][b]MISSION?[/b][/size][/color]

Yes, Wowbagger seems to have a list of certain famous skyrim locals... hmm, if only you could get hold of that list to see what he's up to...

There are eight victims, throughout Skyrim, that he's on a mission to insult. He won't become available until he's ticked off his list.

Note: Maven is his first victim, so she needs to be at the Bee and Barb for the whole quest to initiate. 

[b][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75498-0-1462661810.gif[/img][/b]

With your favourite mod installer in hand, installation is as easy as flying. All you need do is forget to fall. 
Luckily those boffins at the Nexus & Mod Organizer headquarters have made it really easy for you, which is fortunate because nobody likes the ground when it's trying to hit them.



[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75498-4-1462661665.gif[/img][color=#ff0000][size=4][/size][/color]

Wowbagger uses scenes to insult certain game npcs. This all works well, unless the npc in question happens to be already in one of their own scenes. Although, this isn't game breaking... it just means that sometimes you might need to wait around a while before his target is free to be insulted.

Additionally, if a particular npc is no longer in default locations due to main story quest or because you have disposed of them like MXR on a drunken rampage...
Then you will have to advance the quest via console. If this is the case, please refer to the walk through posted on the forum tab. 

I also recommend browsing the posts too for additional information. 

[color=#00ff00][size=4][b][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75498-1-1462661666.gif[/img][/b][/size][/color]
Huge thank you to my fellow modders for jumping in and sorting out my textures. I am a texture numpty!

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3231858/?]Elianora[/url] - Wowbagger
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/161392/?]Cat_Woman1989[/url] - Chekren Centurian
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/4614861/?]Drunkzealot[/url] - Chekren Spheres (texture and mesh)


[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75498-0-1462661666.gif[/img]

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75498-1-1462662541.jpg[/img]

[size=3][b]For Douglas, forever my hero[/b][/size]

For those who don't know who Wowbagger is (you need to bang the rocks together guys) Wowbagger the infinitely prolonged,  is small but much loved creation from the hitchhikers guide to the galaxy novels. 

For me, wowbagger in skyrim initially started of as a small joke side quest, but as I started to get the hang of writing insults for him... he developed so fast that I thought "hang it all" and made the decision to flesh him out enough to make an interesting companion. In regards to companions in general;
I made the decision that this time around I would make him summon-able, rather than constant. Hopefully, this will keep him fresh. I also made the decision to make him a little less interactive than any of previous creations. In regards to further develop, other than fixing and bugs that may appear, I do have a very small idea to make him MCM menu functional, and add selectable "mild " to "really rude" dialogue. But we'll see if the muse bites.[/center]
[center][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/75498-0-1462737183.gif[/img]
[b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61016/?]Carry On Skyrim: M.H.A.R.P.H.I.N.[/url] (Now version 2. Go and get him!)
[b][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53557/?]Carry On Skyr[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53557/?]im: Professor Benjamin Doon[/url][/size][/b]
[b][b][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65427/?]Carry On Skyrim: Another Free Follow[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65427/?]er[/url][/size][/b][/b][/b][/center]
author: skinnytecboy
